a.h1: Havana CUSD Where the future of education is happening now

div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.p: Miss Thomas’ class focused on textual evidence (RI 6.1) this week. After working with a piece of literature focused on tsunamis, the students took the knowledge and applied it to a real-world scenario. They did a GREAT JOB working on their STEM projects!
the move is complete
Students solving equations created by other students
8th graders reading to the PreK students
Learning to use the chromebooks
Mrs. Boyce's class putting together boxes for the Operation Christmas project.
Thanks to donations from the community many students are enjoying new books each month.
Caleb from Dickson Mounds sharing a few history lessons.
Way to go, JV team!
Ready for another meet!

div.h5: Award winning photography by McKenna Bleem

div.p: Way to go!
Ready to go!
Miles Fernetti helped prepare family dinner, and showed us his very healthy bean plant!

Mrs. McGrew challenged her students to a "be creative assignment". Ben Barker built an aircraft carrier out of legos, Andrew Brooks made a portrait of Steve the Sloth, and Jordyn Markley made a parachute. Go Ducks!

#LightsForTheFight thanks to all the healthcare workers, first responders, & all other essential workers on the frontlines fighting this pandemic. Sorry to the Class of 2020, this is not the end to your year you had hoped for, but we are here for you, now and always. Go Ducks!

On Friday night, #IHSA schools throughout Illinois will turn on their lights as a part of #LightsForTheFight to show support for their senior students, as well as for all the healthcare workers, first responders, & all other essential workers on the frontlines of the pandemic. The lights will be lit on our Football field from 8-8:20pm tomorrow night. People are more than welcome to drive by and experience this salute, but please stay in your vehicles and keep doing your part to social-distance. Go Ducks!
